intro: Lachemilla achilleifolia, commonly known as mountain stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Lachemilla achilleifolia thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
